TEXT: The applicant is a NORP national , born in DATE and living in GPE .
A.

The applicant , his wife and his son co - owned , together with CARDINAL other individuals , a land in PERSON which they had jointly purchased in DATE . The CARDINAL families co - owning the property built cottages on the land and reached an agreement as regards its use . In DATE CARDINAL co - owners requested that they should be authorised to accede to their cottage by a car across the plot used by the applicant and his family . An agreement was not reached and the CARDINAL co - owners brought proceedings with a view to having the co - ownership dissolved .

On DATE the Bratislava - vidiek ORG súd ) dissolved the co - ownership and determined the owners of the individual plots forming the estate . It considered such a solution necessary in order to ensure a peaceful enjoyment of the property by all persons involved and also in order to enable the claimants to accede to the plot attributed to them .

On DATE ORG ( PERSON súd ) modified the first instance judgment in that it re - distributed the property with a view to ensuring all owners a direct access to their plots . Since the shares of the former co - owners could not be entirely respected , the persons concerned were granted a compensation .

On DATE ORG ( Najvyšší súd ) quashed the judgment as the facts had not been established with sufficient certainty . In particular , ORG considered that ORG should have explored in more detail the possibility of dividing the property in accordance with the co - ORG shares .

The case was sent back to ORG . On DATE an expert appointed by the latter submitted his opinion on the division of the land . Another expert opinion concerning different issues was submitted on DATE .

At a hearing held on DATE the applicant requested an adjournment of the case as he had not been given an opportunity , despite his CARDINAL requests to this effect , to examine the case - file . The applicant further challenged the CARDINAL expert opinions . As regards the opinion of DATE , the applicant alleged that the data used by the expert were not correct , that the expert had not taken into account all the relevant facts and that the PERSON request for access to their plot with a car was not justified . The applicant suggested that ORG should order a second expert opinion on these issues .
The court scheduled another hearing for DATE so that the applicant could study the case - file on CARDINAL and DATE .

On DATE and DATE the applicant challenged the presiding judge of ORG . The applicant considered that the judge lacked independence and impartiality as he disregarded the opinion expressed in ORG judgment of DATE and since he envisaged to accept the expert opinion of CARDINAL DATE which was based on false facts . He also complained that the judge was not willing to order a second expert opinion .

On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s request . It considered that a mere objection to the way in which the judge proceeded with the case was not a relevant reason for his exclusion . ORG noted that the applicant had not substantiated his allegation that the judge was biased . It qualified the applicant ’s request as an attempt to interfere with the court ’s independence in deciding on the case .

ORG decision was signed by a judge and stated that it was adopted in accordance with LAW ( CARDINAL ) of LAW ( see “ Relevant domestic law and practice ” below ) . On DATE the president of the civil law section of ORG informed the applicant that the decision of DATE had been taken by chamber no . CARDINAL and not by a single judge as alleged by the applicant .

Another hearing before ORG was scheduled for DATE . The applicant requested that the proceedings be adjourned . He alleged that the case was not ready for adjudication , that ORG decision of DATE had not been taken by a chamber as required by LAW ( CARDINAL ) of LAW and that his request of DATE to be allowed to consult the case - file had not been granted .

On DATE ORG upheld the Bratislava - vidiek ORG decision of DATE to dissolve the co - ownership of the land and redistributed the ownership of the individual plots so that the claimants could directly accede to their plot . It referred to the conflicts between the claimants and the applicant ’s family on this issue and held that such a solution conformed to LAW ( CARDINAL ) of LAW .

When determining the shares of the owners ORG noted that it was bound by the purchase contract of CARDINAL DATE which had been duly registered by ORG . According to the contract , the claimant family and the applicant ’s family had a title to CARDINAL of the property each . For practical reasons , the plot attributed to the members of the claimant family exceeded by QUANTITY their original share and the plot attributed to the members of the applicant ’s family exceeded their share by QUANTITY . Both families were therefore ordered to pay a compensation to the other owners who were in agreement . The court further ordered the claimants to pay NORP korunas ( SKK ) CARDINAL to the applicant ’s family as a compensation for a fence and other investments which they had made on the land . The amount of the compensation had been determined by an expert .

The judgment was based on the expert opinion including a geometric plan submitted on DATE . ORG noted that the opinion conformed to the relevant regulations . The court also referred to its CARDINAL inspections of the site of CARDINAL DATE and DATE respectively .

On DATE the applicant complained to the president of ORG that the judgment of DATE had not been served on him . He alleged a violation of LAW ( CARDINAL ) of LAW . On DATE the president of ORG informed the applicant that he had extended the time - limit for drafting the judgment with reasons until DATE as the judge originally charged with this task was on a long - term sick leave . The judgment was served on the applicant on CARDINAL DATE .

On DATE the applicant lodged an appeal on points of law with ORG . He alleged that ORG had not established the facts correctly and that it had decided arbitrarily . In his view , ORG had disregarded a mistake committed by ORG when registering the co - ORG shares on DATE . The applicant also complained that the expert opinion of CARDINAL DATE had been based on false facts , that his request for a second expert opinion had not been granted and that there existed no relevant reasons for granting the claimants access to their plot by a car .

The applicant further alleged that prior to the hearing held on DATE ORG had not allowed him to consult the case - file , that his son had not been duly summoned and that ORG judgment had been served belatedly . He complained that he had suffered a damage of SKK CARDINAL which ORG had not taken into consideration .

ORG dismissed the appeal on points of law on DATE . It found that ORG had proceeded in accordance with LAW ( CARDINAL ) of LAW and that the reasons for its judgment were relevant and sufficient . ORG noted that the co - ORG shares had been duly registered by ORG in DATE and found nothing to show that the expert opinion of CARDINAL DATE did not conform to the law or was otherwise defective . The failure to order a second expert opinion was not contrary to the applicant ’s right to act before the court .

ORG further established that the damages granted to the applicant ’s family had been determined by an expert and that the applicant ’s complaint about further damage of SKK CARDINAL,CARDINAL had not been the subject - matter of the proceedings in question . Finally , ORG found that the applicant had consulted the file several times and considered it irrelevant that he could not accede to it prior to the hearing held on DATE .

The applicant lodged a constitutional petition ( podnet ) in which he alleged a violation of his constitutional right to judicial protection . It was rejected on DATE . ORG found that the applicant ’s right to have his case examined by a court was respected .
B. Relevant domestic law and practice
Civil Code

Section CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) gives a court the right to dissolve , at the request of CARDINAL of the co - owners , a joint ownership and to determine the rights of the persons concerned if the latter fail to reach an agreement on this issue . In doing so , the court shall consider the co - ORG shares in the property and bear in mind that its use should be effective .
Code of Civil Procedure
Pursuant to LAW ( CARDINAL ) , the decision on a request for exclusion of a judge shall be taken by a chamber of the higher court .
In accordance with LAW ( CARDINAL ) , parties to the proceeding and their representative have the right to consult the case - file with the exception of the records of votes .

Section CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) provides that a court shall appoint an expert after having heard the parties if its decision in a case depends on the assessment of facts requiring special knowledge . Pursuant to LAW ) , an expert opinion may be submitted for examination to another expert , a scientific institute or another institution .

In accordance with the relevant case - law ( Collection of the judicial decisions and opinions No . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) , experts may also prepare opinions after an agreement with natural or legal persons . The interested persons may then submit such opinions to the courts which should consider them as a documentary evidence .

Under Section CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) , a copy of the judgment with reasons should be dispatched within DATE after its delivery . The court ’s president may grant a derogation from this rule provided that it is justified by serious reasons .
